text: The first computer mouse was made of wood and was invented by Douglas Engelbart in 1964.
The first website was created by Tim Berners-Lee in 1991 and is still online at http://info.cern.ch.
IBM Simon, released in 1994, is considered to be the first smartphone.
The Apollo 11 guidance computer, which helped land humans on the moon, had a processing power similar to a modern calculator.
The first 1GB hard drive, released in 1980, weighed 550 pounds and cost $40,000.
Nolan Bushnell and Ted Dabney founded Atari in 1972, which pioneered the video game industry with their game Pong.
ENIAC, the first electronic general-purpose computer, was completed in 1945 and weighed 30 tons.
The World Wide Web and the internet are not the same thing. The internet is a global network of computers, while the web is a collection of documents and resources connected by hyperlinks.
Ray Tomlinson sent the first email in 1971, and he also introduced the use of the @ symbol to separate the user and the host in email addresses.
